page.title: 14The River Derwent
page.content: The River Derwent is a fairly wide river with high energy which has caused meanders, to slow the river down. The river comes from Derwent Water and the surrounding catchment area and flows towards Cockermouth where the river Cocker merges with it. It then continues on its way to Workington and the sea. The river is in a wide valley, it does not fill the valley bottom but bends from side to side as it flows from the north east corner of the area to the south west corner. On one section of the river bank there is a bad patch of soil erosion. This was caused by the trees on the bank being cut down by the owner of Isel Hall in 1983. There is a weir which crosses the river near the hospital.
